sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 
Suppose that \(n + p = 2o \) and also it is given that 
\[
	\frac{1}{o } + \frac{1}{q } = \frac{2}{p }
\]
Now, prove that \(n \), \(o \), \(p \), and \(q \) are in proportion.
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "It is given that 
\[
	\frac{1}{o } + \frac{1}{q } = \frac{2}{p }
\]
\[
	\frac{q + o }{oq } = \frac{2}{p }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow pq + op = 2oq 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow pq + op = (n + p )q 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow pq + op = nq + pq 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow op = nq 
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{n }{o } = \frac{p }{q }
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
This means that $n $, $o $, $p $, and $q $ are in proportion.

Hence proved.
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Upon taking LCM's and cross-multiplying we get $pq + op = 2oq $}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Since, it is given that $n + p = 2o$, replacing $2o, we get $ pq + op = (n + p )q $}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Upon opening up the bracket and cancelling the common terms on both sides we get $op = nq$}$$ "}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Upon dividing both sides by $oq$, we get $\frac{n }{o } = \frac{p }{q }$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}]
